findings.title: Reentrancy in CashOut allows multiple withdrawals
findings.explanation: The contract makes an external call to msg.sender.call.value(_am)() before updating the user's balance, allowing a malicious contract to reenter CashOut and withdraw more funds than they deposited.
findings.fix_suggestion: Follow the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern: deduct the user's balance before making external calls. Consider using transfer instead of call or implement a reentrancy guard.

findings.title: Untrusted external call to logging contract can cause DoS
findings.explanation: Both Deposit and CashOut unconditionally call the external Log.AddMessage function. If the Log contract reverts or consumes excessive gas, it will block deposits and withdrawals, resulting in a denial of service.
findings.fix_suggestion: Replace the external logging contract with internal events or use low-level calls with gas limits and handle failures gracefully so that logging failures do not revert core functionality.

unmatched_predictions.title: Untrusted external call to logging contract can cause DoS
